title: 114_hr6204
content: The Act is titled the "No Cost Educational Resources Act" and includes provisions for grants. Section 262 of the Museum and Library Services Act is amended to include provisions for facilitating the adoption, adaption, and creation of open educational reading materials and establishing more open educational reading material courses. The amendment to Section 262 of the Museum and Library Services Act introduces definitions for open educational reading material and courses that use only open educational reading materials for science, technology, engineering, or math courses at higher education institutions. The amendment to Section 262 of the Museum and Library Services Act requires higher education institutions to submit an application for a grant to facilitate the adoption of open educational reading materials. The application must include plans for collaboration with STEM faculty and assigning leadership to library administrators and librarians. The grant application for higher education institutions must include plans for collaborating with faculty, other institutions, and reviewing the quality of open educational reading materials. Priority is given to institutions enrolling a high number of low-income or minority students. The grant application for higher education institutions must include plans to coordinate the implementation of open educational reading material courses, use library resources, and provide incentives for faculty to use open educational reading materials for science, technology, engineering, and mathematics courses with high enrollment. The Director must submit a report to Congress within 2 years of the first grant award, detailing the number of grants awarded, the impact on increasing STEM courses using open educational materials, and the cost savings achieved. The Director must submit a report to Congress within 2 years of the first grant award, detailing the cost savings achieved by students enrolling in open educational material courses compared to those with required purchases.
